page.title: 01Haytor and Rippon Tor
page.content: Haytor rocks (1490 ft) are perhaps the most well known rocky outcrop within the Dartmoor National Park. It is the start point for many walks and each year the rocks are climbed by many thousands of visitors, who are assisted by the steps that were cut into the rocks during the nineteenth century. Although by no means the highest tor on Dartmoor, Haytor is the most visible and outstanding tor viewed from the southern part of Devon. Especially from the main A38 trunk road to Plymouth Haytor's twin tors can be seen as an outstanding landmark. The area is virtually all moorland with grazing for sheep, cattle and Dartmoor ponies. Other tors in the area are Rippon Tor to the S (473 metres), Saddle, Holwell and Hollow Tors.
